column4: Hello ppl - ubuntu 9.04 - I reinstalled alsamixer after having sound problems, so now I can hear without any problem but the mic isn't working... :\
call up alsamixer in the terminal... the mic is probably muted.
That's the problem - it's all up. That was the problem last time - everything was up and still there was no sound, only after reinstalling i could hear sound
highlight the imc and press m on your keyboard
same for your PCM and master channels, if necessary
The mic is up there, pressing m made no difference

look below the master channel and the PCM channel. you should see a green square if the channel is active and an empty square if it is muted. make sure they are turned up before you bother with the mic
Their up. I can hear songs and stuff, it's the mic that isn't working (built in, it's a laptop)
press F5 in alsamixer and make sure the mic is set as the capture device
Also, last time I had to reinstall because everything was up, nothing muted, yet I couldn't hear anything, but the mic worked.
I think it is F5... let me make sure
The capture is up and green, not muted
Just out of curiosity, how did you know the mic was working if ou had no sound\?
All up and is set to max (master, capture, etc) - got other idea?

As far as I can tell, you have alsa working, I think you just need to make sure pulse is using alsa's output. I don't actually have an ubuntu box running in front of me now, so I can't see the menu, which would make it very difficult for me to help you.:-/
no problem... I think it might help dpkg-reconfigure the pulseaudio package, but since I've never done that before you should probably not take my word for it
